page.title: 12CHEESE MAKING
page.content: THE MAKING OF CHEESE HAS CHANGED FROM A COTTAGE INDUSTRY INTO A MANUFACTURING PROCESS ON A LARGE SCALE. CHEESE MAKING TAKES PLACE IN EARLY SUMMER WHEN THERE IS A SULPHUS OF MILK, I.E THERE IS MORE MILK PRODUCED THAN IS NEEDED FOR DRINKING. THE MILK FOR CHEESE IS PLACED IN A LARGE DOUBLE SKINNED,STAINLESS STEEL CONTAINER AND WARMED GENTLY.A STARTER SOLUTION IS ADDED AND THE MILK IS STIRRED.AN ACID STATE IS REACHED,STIRRING IS STOPPED AND THE MILK BECOMES A LARGE JUNKET.THIS JUNKET IS CUT INTO CUBES,FROM THIS THE WHEY IS TAKEN OFF.TO THE SEMI SOLID SALT IS ADDED.IT IS TURNED,CUT AND KNEEDED.IT IS THEN SHREDDED,PLACED INTO A CONTAINER AND PRESSED. CHEDDAR CHEESE NEEDS SIX MONTHS TO MATURE AND IS TURNED EVERYDAY.
